page.title: 10Garretts Farm - Eastchurch
page.content: Garretts Farm is typical of the farms in the Eastchurch area. The present owner has farmed the{land}for seventeen years. It covers an area of 270 acres and is largely arable land apart from the presence of 50{sheep which will go at the end of this year. The climate and soil are particularly suitable for growing{crops,}mainly wheat, potatoes and peas. The original farmhouse was built 300 years ago with additions made at a later date. There have been changes in the use of the land recently as orchards were removed and better drainage meant more intensive{farming. The farmer has recently aquired the land only from Trouts Farm on the other side of the road.
